Package models

Class Configurables

java.lang.Object
models.Configurables
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Configurables extends Object implements Serializable
Java class that store system-wide variables not associated to an instance of any object

The system-wide variables are the base price of movie and list of public holidays. Both attributes are used to calculate ticket price, but the values are changed for the entire system instead of for the individual tickets themselves

There should only be one Configurables object throughout the entire system. All ticket issuance will refer to this Configurables object to calculate pricing. This object is initialized inside Developer#Initializer(), with base price set to 7 and Christmas 2022 declared as public holiday.

Since:
2022-8-11
Version:
1.0
Author:
Chee Wen Zhan

  • Constructor Details

    • Configurables

      public Configurables(int year, int month, int day, double basePrice)
      Constructor of the Configurables Class.

      Initializes the base price of a movie ticket, which can later be changed using configure() method. Also initializes at least one public holiday by taking in input of year, month and day of the public holiday, and create a new LocalDateTime object with minute = 0 and second = 0

      Parameters:
      year -
      month -
      day -
      basePrice -
      See Also:
      • Configurables#configure()
      • LocalDateTime

    • holidayMatch

      public boolean holidayMatch(LocalDateTime inputDateTime)
      Checks if the date passed as argument is in fact a public holiday as declared in this system
      Parameters:
      inputDateTime - LocalDateTime object, but only the date is used to check for public holiday status
      Returns:
